title: 1998 AHSME Problem 28
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"In "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\triangle ABC"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\angle C"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a right angle and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"CB > CA"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Point "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"D"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is located on "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"BC"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" so that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\angle CAD"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is twice "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\angle DAB"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\dfrac {AC}{AD} = \\dfrac 23"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\dfrac {CD}{BD} = \\dfrac mn"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are relatively prime positive integers. Find "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m+n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/6xqlOko9K5-b190315a.png?width=1200"}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\angle DAB = \theta"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\angle CAD = 2\theta"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":",  Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"AC = 2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"AD=3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". By Pythagorean theorem "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\begin{aligned} CD^2 & = AD^2 - AC^2 = 3^2 - 2^2 = 5
\\ \implies CD & = \sqrt 5
\end{aligned} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Then we have:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\begin{aligned} \tan 2\theta & = \frac {CD}{AC} = \frac {\sqrt 5}2
\\ \frac {2\tan \theta}{1-\tan^2 \theta} & = \frac {\sqrt 5}2
\\ \sqrt 5 \tan^2 \theta + 4\tan \theta - \sqrt 5 & = 0
\\ (\sqrt 5 \tan \theta - 1)(\tan \theta + \sqrt 5) & = 0
\\ \implies \tan \theta & = \frac 1{\sqrt 5} & \small \color{#3D99F6} \text{Since }\theta < \frac \pi 2
\end{aligned} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"And that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\tan 3 \theta = \dfrac {\tan \theta + \tan 2\theta}{1-\tan \theta \tan 2\theta} = \dfrac {\frac 1{\sqrt 5}+\frac{\sqrt 5}2}{1-\frac 1{\sqrt 5}\times \frac {\sqrt 5}2} = \dfrac 7{\sqrt 5}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We note that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"BC = AC \tan 3 \theta = 2 \tan 3 \theta = \dfrac {14}{\sqrt 5}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".  Then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"BD = BC - CD = \dfrac {14}{\sqrt 5} - \sqrt 5 = \dfrac 9{\sqrt 5}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac {CD}{BD} = \frac {\sqrt 5}{\frac 9{\sqrt 5}} = \dfrac 59"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".  "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m+n = 5+9 = \boxed{14}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 1998 AHSME Problem 29
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A point (x,y) in the plane is called a lattice point if both x and y are integers. The area of the largest square that contains exactly three lattice points in its interior is closest to"}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Applying Pick's Theorem,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A = I + (B/2) - 1,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"where A is the area, I is the number of points in the interior, and B is the number of points on the boundary "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A = 3 + (4/2) - 1 = 4."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

                                            WHEN I ANSWERED 4 IT TOLD ME WRONG!!!

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"

title: 1998 AHSME Problem 3
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/solvable/e7ed7c4b9b.2088b778b1.xtP8Kd.png?width=250"}},{"type":"text","text":"\nIf a, b, and c are digits for which the above is true, then a+b+c ="}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Flip the order"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"https://imgur.com/mmVRiBr.jpg"}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Then we easily see that B = 9, the one carries over so A = 6, the one carries over again so C= 2."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore, we have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" a + b + c = \boxed{17} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"trial and error method "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"762-489=273 so a=6,b=9 and c=2"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"so a+b+c=17"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 1998 AHSME Problem 30
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"For each positive integer n, let\n"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a_n = \\frac{(n+9)!}{(n-1)!}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"\nLet k denote the smallest positive integer for which the rightmost nonzero digit of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a_k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is odd. The rightmost nonzero digit of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a_k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is"}]}]}

title: 1998 AHSME Problem 4
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Define [a, b, c] to mean (a+b)/c, where c is not equal to 0. What is the value of"}]},{"type":"text","text":"\n\n"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"[[60, 30, 90], [2, 1, 3], [10, 5, 15]] ?"}]}]}

title: 1998 AHSME Problem 5
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2^{1998}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" -  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2^{1997}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" -  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2^{1996}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" +  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2^{1995}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" =  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"k \\times 2^{1995}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", what is the value of k?"}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Hello all,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"as 2^(1998 )- 2^(1997) - 2^(1996) + 2^(1995) = k x 2^(1995)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"factor out 2^(1995),"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2^(1995)(2^3 - 2^2 -2 + 2^0) =  2^(1995)(k)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"dividing both by 2^(1995),"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(2^3 - 2^2 - 2 + 2^0) = k"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"k = 8-4-2+1 = 3,therefore , k = 3,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"thanks..."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 1998 AHSME Problem 6
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If 1998 is written as a product of two positive integers whose difference is as small as possible, then the difference is:"}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Note that :- "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \sqrt[3]{N} =N^{\frac{1}{3}} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"
Therefore the expression is equal to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" (N(N(N)^{\frac{1}{3}})^{\frac{1}{3}})^{\frac{1}{3}} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" =  (N(N^{\frac{4}{3}})^{\frac{1}{3}})^{\frac{1}{3}} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" = (N(N^{\frac{4}{9}}))^{\frac{1}{3}} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" = (N^{\frac{13}{9}})^{\frac{1}{3}} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" = N^{\frac{13}{27}} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 1998 AHSME Problem 8
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/solvable/e7ed7c4b9b.911f68aed2.HSxgqF.png?width=250"}},{"type":"text","text":"\nA square with sides of length 1 is divided into two congruent trapezoids and a pentagon, which have equal areas, by joining the center of the square with points on three of the sides, as shown. Find x, the length of the longer parallel side of each trapezoid."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The symmetry suggests that the point inside is actually the square centre. Then we can say:
(1-x)"},{"type":"text","text":"1+ (x-1/2)/2 = 1/3 or (x+1/2)","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":"1/2*1/2 =1/3. Either way, x = 5/6"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 1998 AHSME Problem 9
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A speaker talked for sixty minutes to a full auditorium. Twenty percent of the audience heard the entire talk and ten percent slept through the entire talk. Half of the remainder heard one third of the talk and the other half heard two thirds of the talk. What was the average number of minutes of the talk heard by members of the audience?"}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"By the question we have,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"20% heard 60 minutes."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"10% heard 0 minutes."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Half the remainder , "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" = \frac{70\%}{2} = 35\% "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" heard 20 minutes "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"And the other 35% heard 40 minutes."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore average number of minutes heard "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" = 20\% \times 60 + 10\% \times 0 + 35\% \times 20 + 35\% \times 40 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" = 0.2 \times 60 + 0 + .35 \times 20 + .35 \times 40 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" = 12 + 7 + 14 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" = \boxed{33} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}
